page.title: 10St Mary's Church, Ash Vale.
page.content: This year sees the centenary of St Mary's Church in Ash Vale. The original corrugated iron church was dedicated on the Eve of the Annunciation l885. The present brick building was designed by A.J. Stedman and the foundation stone was laid on May the 9th, 1906 by the Hon. H. Cubitt, the Lord Lieutenant of Surrey and it was dedicated by the Bishop of Winchester. The bricks for the new church were transported by barges on the canal. The new church was opened and dedicated by the Bishop of Dorking on the 24th of November 1906.
